column1: '''Galvorn''' was a metal devised by [[Eöl]] from which he made resistant armor. Black and "shining like jet"
column4: proving resistant to all blades and darts.<ref>{{S|Maeglin}}</ref>

column1: It's possible that galvorn was forgotten or lost with Eöl's death
column2: as it was not mentioned in the later [[Ages]].<ref>{{HM|Guide}}

column1: The word ''galvorn'' translates as "shining black" in [[Sindarin]]. It is formed by combining ''[[gal]]''
column3: signifying "dark" or "black".<ref>"[http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth]" at [http://www.tolkiendil.com/ Tolkiendil.com] (accessed 8 June 2011)</ref>

column2: the metal of Eöl. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] changed this many times
